page.title: 13Trade - Aby
page.content: The main trade is the sale of food grown on the farms, and the buying in of the seeds, fertilizers and machinery. Livestock is sold at local markets held weekly in Alford and Louth, where the animals are graded and sold by auction. Wool is sold to the Wool Marketing Board, peas are sent direct to fast freezing centres and fish (fresh trout) suppllied to factories and shops. Smoked fish is sold direct at the smokery. Grain is sold in bulk to grain merchants for malting, animal feed and storage for E.C.C. Potatoes are stored, then graded and sold all the year round. Some are supplied direct to crisp factories. Sugar beet is taken by lorry to Bardney where it is refined. Eggs for grading are sent to an egg packing station or sold direct to the public. Woodthorpe has a Garden Centre
